To add 1 to the `White_Points` variable when a `Pawn` is captured, you can simply use the `+=` operator to increment the value of `White_Points` by 1. You don't need to use `append()` as it is used to add an element to a list, not to increment a variable.

Here's an example of how you can modify the code to increment `White_Points` by 1 when a `Pawn` is captured:
```scss
White_Points = 0

captured = board.squares[released_row][released_col].has_piece()
if captured:
    captured_piece = board.squares[released_row][released_col].piece
    if type(captured_piece) == piece.Pawn:
        White_Points += 1
        print("Captured piece is a Pawn")
    else:
        print("Captured piece is not a Pawn")

print("White points:", White_Points)
```
In this code, we increment `White_Points` by 1 using the `+=` operator when a `Pawn` is captured. We then print the value of `White_Points` using `print("White points:", White_Points)` to show the updated score.

You can modify the code to keep track of the score for other pieces as well, by adding similar variables and incrementing them appropriately.
